name: Typical untreated domestic wastewater
note: Typical composition of untreated domestic wastewater. Note: there is no typical wastewater, values should only be used as guide! Data presented are for medium-strengths wastewater based on average flow of 460 L/cap*day and include constituents added by commercial institutional, and industrial sources.
reference: Asano et al., 2006 p. 107. Value for Turbidity: Asano et al., 2006, p.109. Viruses: Asano et al., 2006, p.110

name: Primary effluent
note: Constituents remaining after primary treatment. Primary treatment consisted of a rotary drum screen , followed by disk screens

name: Secondary effluent- water hyacinths
note: Constituents remaining after secondary treatment. Secondary treatment was with water hyacinths

name: Secondary effluent- CAS
note: Constituents remaining after secondary treatment. Secondary treatment was conventional activated sludge (CAS).

name: Secondary effluent- CAS + filtration
note: Constituents remaining after secondary treatment. Secondary treatment was conventional activated sludge (CAS) with filtration

name: Secondary effluent- activated sludge + BNR
note: Constituents remaining after secondary treatment. Secondary treatment was activated sludge with biological nutrient removal for the removal of nitrogen and phosphorus

name: Secondary effluent- activated sludge + BR+ filtration
note: Constituents remaining after secondary treatment. Secondary treatment was activated sludge with biological nutrient removal (for the removal of nitrogen and phosphorus) and filtration

name: Secondary effluent- membrane bioreactor
note: Constituents remaining after secondary treatment. Secondary treatment was membrane bioreactor

name: Secondary effluent- activated sludge + MF + RO
note: Constituents remaining after secondary treatment. Secondary treatment was activated sludge with microfiltration and reverse osmosis.

name: Tertiary effluent
note: Constituents remaining after tertiary treatment. Tertiary treatment consisted of lime precipitation and depth filtration

name: AWT effluent
note: Constituents remaining after advanced wastewater treatment (AWT).

name: Textile Industry-India
note: Average Values and (ranges) from six Indian textile industries

name: Textile Industry- Nigeria
note: Average Values and (ranges) from five Nigerian textile mills

name: Dairy- Industry India
note: Characteristics of raw dairy wastewater of A.P. Diary in Hyderabad, India

name: Dairy Industry- Cheese
note: Ranges or mean values reported from3 cheese industry examples

name: Dairy Industry- Cheese whey
note: Ranges or mean values reported from2 cheese whey industry examples

name: Dairy Industry- Mixed processing
note: Ranges or mean values reported from2 mixed dairy industry examples

name: Paper mill
note: Typical characteristics of wastewater at paper mill

name: Winery (Production: 3000 m3/year)
note: Example of one wine producing industry

name: Winery (Production: 6000 m3/year)
note: Example of one wine producing industry

name: EPA: Urban Reuse- unrestricted
note: Definition: Use of reclaimed water in non-potable applications in municipal settings where public access is not restricted. Treatment: Secondary, filtration, disinfection

name: EPA: Urban Reuse-restricted
note: Definition: Use of reclaimed water in non-potable applications in municipal settings where public access is restricted by physical/institutional barriers Treatment: Secondary, disinfection

name: EPA: Agricultural Reuse-Food Crops
note: Definition: Use of reclaimed water for surface or spray irrigation of food crops eaten raw Treatment: Secondary, filtration, disinfection

name: EPA: Agricultural Reuse-Processed food crops and Non-food crops
note: Definition: Use of reclaimed water for surface or spray irrigation of food crops processed prior to consumption and non-food crops like fodder, fiber etc. Treatment: Secondary, disinfection

name: EPA: Impoundments-unrestricted
note: Definition: Use of reclaimed water in an impoundment in which no limitations are imposed on body contact Treatment: Secondary, filtration, disinfection

name: EPA: Impoundments-restricted
note: Definition: Use of reclaimed water in an impoundment where bod-contact is restricted Treatment: Secondary, disinfection

name: EPA: Environmental Reuse
note: Definition: Use of reclaimed water to create wetlands, enhance natural wetlands or sustain stream flows Treatment: Variable, secondary, and disinfection

name: EPA: Industrial Reuse- Once-through cooling
note: Treatment: Secondary

name: EPA: Industrial Reuse- Recirculating Cooling Towers
note: Treatment: Secondary, disinfection

name: EPA: Groundwater Recharge-Indirect potable re-use
note: Definition: Groundwater recharge by spreading into potable aquifers or by injection into potable aquifers and augmentation of surface water supply reservoirs Treatment: Secondary, filtration, disinfection, advanced wastewater treatment or soil aquifer treatment

name: Texas EPA: Urban Reuse- unrestricted
note: Add. Parameter: Enterococci: 4 CFU/100mL (max. 9 CFU/100mL)

name: Texas EPA: Urban Reuse-restricted
note: BOD: 20 mg/L without pond; 30 mg/L with pond Add. Parameter: Enterococci: 35 CFU/100mL (max. 89 CFU/100mL)

name: Texas EPA: Agricultural Reuse-Food Crops
note: Add. Parameter: Enterococci: 4 CFU/100mL (max. 9 CFU/100mL)

name: Texas EPA: Agricultural Reuse-Processed food crops and Non-food crops
note: BOD: 20 mg/L without pond; 30 mg/L with pond Add. Parameter: Enterococci: 35 CFU/100mL (max. 89 CFU/100mL)

name: Texas EPA: Impoundments-unrestricted
note: Add. Parameter: Enterococci: 4 CFU/100ml (max. 9 CFU/100mL)

name: Texas EPA: Impoundments-restricted
note: BOD: 20 mg/L without pond; 30 mg/L with pond Add. Parameter: Enterococci: 35 CFU/100mL (max. 89 CFU/100mL)

name: Texas EPA: Environmental Reuse
note: Not regulated

name: Texas EPA: Industrial Reuse- Recirculating Cooling Towers
note: BOD: 20 mg/L without pond; 30 mg/L with pond Add. Parameter: Enterococci: 35 CFU/100mL (max. 89 CFU/100mL)

name: Texas EPA: Groundwater Recharge-Indirect potable re-use
note: Add. Parameter: Enterococci: 4 CFU/100mL (max. 9 CFU/100mL)

name: California EPA: Urban Reuse- unrestricted
note: For media filters: 2 NTU (avg.)/ 10 NTU (max.) For membrane filters: 0.2 NTU (avg.)/ 0.5 NTU (max.) Total coliform: 240/100 ml (max.)

name: California EPA: Urban Reuse-restricted
note: Total coliform: 240/100 ml (max.)

name: California EPA: Agricultural Reuse-Food Crops
note: For media filters: 2 NTU (avg.)/ 10 NTU (max.) For membrane filters: 0.2 NTU (avg.)/ 0.5 NTU (max.) Total coliform: 240/100 ml (max.)

name: California EPA: Agricultural Reuse-Processed food crops and Non-food crops
note: Total coliforms are not specified in the Californian standards.

name: California EPA: Impoundments-unrestricted
note: For media filters: 2 NTU (avg.)/ 10 NTU (max.) For membrane filters: 0.2 NTU (avg.)/ 0.5 NTU (max.) Total coliform: 240/100 ml (max.) Supplemental pathogen monitoring

name: California EPA: Impoundments-restricted
note: Total coliform: 23/100 ml (not more than one sample exceeds this value in 30d)

name: California EPA: Environmental Reuse
note: Not regulated

name: California EPA: Industrial Reuse- Once-through cooling
note: For media filters: 2 NTU (avg.)/ 10 NTU (max.) For membrane filters: 0.2 NTU (avg.)/ 0.5 NTU (max.) Total coliform: 240/100 ml (max.)

name: California EPA: Groundwater Recharge-Indirect potable re-use
note: For media filters: 2 NTU (avg.)/ 10 NTU (max.) For membrane filters: 0.2 NTU (avg.)/ 0.5 NTU (max.) Total coliform: 240/100 ml (max.) Pathogen monitoring is not required but virus removal rates are prescribed by treatment requirements

name: WHO: Use of wastewater in agriculture-unrestricted
note: Definition: Irrigation with wastewater of all agricultural crops Standards for E.coli in CFU/100 mL: Root crops:103 ; Leaf crops: 104 ; Drip irrigation, high growing crops: 105

name: WHO: Use of wastewater in agriculture-restricted-highly mechanized irrigation
note: Definition: Irrigation with wastewater of all agricultural crops except crops eaten unprocessed/raw (like lettuce). Standards for E.coli in CFU/100 mL: Labour-intensive irrigation: 104 ; High mechanized agriculture: 105 ; Drip irrigation, high growing crops: 105

name: WHO: Use of wastewater in agriculture- restricted-labour intensive irrigation
note: Definition: Irrigation of all agricultural crops except crops eaten unprocessed/raw (like lettuce). Standards for E.coli in CFU/100 mL: Labour-intensive irrigation: 104 ; High mechanized agriculture: 105

name: WHO: Use of wastewater in aquaculture
note: Standards for E.coli in CFU/100 mL: Consumers: 105 ;Workers: 104 No trematode eggs detectable

name: WHO: Use of grey water in agriculture-unrestricted
note: Definition: Irrigation with grey water of all agricultural crops Standards for E.coli in CFU/100 mL: High growing crops or Drip irrigation: 104

name: WHO: Use of grey water in agriculture-restricted
note: Definition: Irrigation with grey water of all agricultural crops except crops eaten unprocessed/raw (like lettuce).

name: Wastewater: Category A Untrestricted irrigation
note: Definition: Irrigation with wastewater of vegetable and salad crops eaten uncooked, sport fields, public parks Irrigation technique: any Exposed group: Workers, consumers, public

name: Wastewater: Category B Restricted irrigation
note: Definition: Irrigation with wastewater of cereal crops, industrial crops, fodder crops, pasture and trees Irrigation technique: spray or sprinkler (105 E.coli CFU/mL); Flood or furrow (103 E.coli CFU/mL) Exposed group: Workers, nearby communities

name: Wastewater: Category C
note: Definition: Localized irrigation with wastewater of crops in category B if exposure of workers and the public does not occur. Irrigation technique: Trickle, drip or bubbler Exposed group: None No water quality measures have to be met

name: Greywater: Category A
note: Definition: Irrigation with greywater of ornamental fruit trees and fodder crops

name: Greywater: Category B
note: Definition: Irrigation with greywater of vegetables likely to be eaten uncooked.

name: Greywater: Category C
note: Definition: Greywater used for toilet flushing

name: Discharge to streams
note: Definition: Discharge of wastewater to streams, wadis and water storage area E.coli counts (FC) are given in MPN/100mL

name: Groundwater recharge
note: Definition: Wastewater used for groundwater recharge E.coli counts (FC) are given in MPN/100mL

name: Agricultural irrigation Group A
note: Definition: Irrigation with wastewater for cooked vegetables, parking areas, playgrounds and side of roads inside cities E.coli counts (FC) are given in MPN/100mL

name: Agricultural irrigation Group B
note: Definition: Irrigation with wastewater for plenteous trees and green areas, side of roads outside cities E.coli counts (FC) are given in MPN/100mL

name: Agricultural irrigation Group C
note: Definition: Irrigation with wastewater for field crops, industrial crops and forestry

name: AQUAREC: Private, urban irrigation Category 1
note: Specific final uses (according to microbial categories): I: Residential uses II: Bathing water III: Urban uses (irrigation of landscape areas, street cleaning, fire-fighting) and unrestricted irrigation IV: Irrigation of industrial crops  and animal fodder, restricted irrigation V: Irrigation of forested areas and restricted access areas Additional Total Kjeldahl N: 15-20 mg/L

name: AQUAREC: Environmental and aquaculture Category 2
note: Specific final uses (according to microbial categories): IV: Impoundments, water bodies and streams for recreational use with access (except bathing) V: Impoundments, water bodies and streams for recreational use with access (except bathing) VI: Surface water quality, water bodies and streams for recreational use with restricted access Total Kjeldahl N: 10-20 mg/L

name: AQUAREC: Indirect aquifer recharge Category 3
note: Specific final uses (according to microbial categories): V: Aquifer recharge by localized percolation through the soil

name: AQUAREC: Industrial cooling Category 4
note: Specific final uses (according to microbial categories): VII: Industrial cooling except for the food industry Total Kjeldahl N: 10 mg/L

name: CHL - Drinking water for human consumption
CHL - Water for surface water or groundwater recharge
ARG - Drinking water for human consumption
ARG - Water for agricultural Irrigation(non-food crops)
MEX - Drinking water for human consumption
MEX - Water for public service with direct contact
MEX - Water for public service without direct contact
Pos-Class A - very low
note: A = Water quality is very low.  Water cannot be reused for any purpose nor discharged and needs treatment.

name: Pos-Class B - low
note: B = Water quality is low.  Water cannot be reused for any purpose but can be discharged according to the national regulations.

name: Pos-Class C - medium
note: C = Water quality is medium. Water could be reused for restricted agricultural (food crops not consumed uncooked) and/or industrial purposes.

name: Pos-Class D - good
note: D = Water quality is good. Water could be reused for agriculture and other non-potable uses in industry or in the urban network.

name: Pos-Class E - excellent
note: E = Water quality is excellent. Water could be reused for potable uses.

name: Class A - very low
note: A = Water quality is very low.  Water cannot be reused for any purpose nor discharged and needs treatment.

name: Class B - low
note: B = Water quality is low.  Water cannot be reused for any purpose but can be discharged according to the national regulations.

name: Class C - medium
note: C = Water quality is medium. Water could be reused for restricted agricultural (food crops not consumed uncooked) and/or industrial purposes.

name: Class D - good
note: D = Water quality is good. Water could be reused for agriculture and other non-potable uses in industry or in the urban network.

name: Class E - excellent
note: E = Water quality is excellent. Water could be reused for potable uses.

name: Class A - discharge with drinking water function
note: Discharge to water bodies with a function of drinking water supply (Class A)  .QCVN 40:2011

name: Class B - discharge without drinking water function
note: Discharge to water bodies without function of drinking water supply (Class B)  QCVN 40:2011

reference: National technical regulation on water quality for irrigation (QCVN 39: 2011/BTNMT)

name: Law 48/1982: Protection of the River Nile and water ways
note: (El Bouraie et al. 2011) Egyptian Law for protection of the River Nile and water ways from pollution

name: Class A: All food crops
note: All food crops, including root crops consumed raw and food crops where the edible portion is in direct contact with reclaimed water. The European Commission proposed on May 2018 new rules to stimulate and facilitate water reuse in the EU for agricultural irrigation. (Alcalde-Sanz and Gawilk 2017)

name: Class B: Food crops that is not in direct contact with reclaimed water, processed food crops, non-food crops
note: Food crops consumed raw where the edible portion is produced above ground and is not in direct contact with reclaimed water / Processed food crops / Non-food crops including crops to feed milk- or meat-producing animals. The European Commission proposed on May 2018 new rules to stimulate and facilitate water reuse in the EU for agricultural irrigation. (Alcalde-Sanz and Gawilk 2017)

name: Class C: Food crops that is not in direct contact with reclaimed water, processed food crops, non-food crops
note: Food crops consumed raw where the edible portion is produced above ground and is not in direct contact with reclaimed water / Processed food crops / Non-food crops including crops to feed milk- or meat-producing animals. The European Commission proposed on May 2018 new rules to stimulate and facilitate water reuse in the EU for agricultural irrigation. (Alcalde-Sanz and Gawilk 2017)

name: Class D: Industrial, energy, and seeded crops
note: Industrial, energy, and seeded crops. The European Commission proposed on May 2018 new rules to stimulate and facilitate water reuse in the EU for agricultural irrigation. (Alcalde-Sanz and Gawilk 2017)
